projects.name: Pokédexle
projects.description: Pokédexle is a Pokémon guessing game. Like many, I was caught up in the Wordle craze of early 2022. I was also playing Pokémon Arceus at the time. The idea hit me that Pokémon would be a perfect adaptation, and thus Pokédexle was born.

projects.name: Tidbyt Solar Display
projects.description: This is a pixlet app built for my Tidbyt to display the current power generated by my solar panels. It involves an Express server that communicates with SMA solar inverters. The pixlet app makes API calls to the Express server to get the current power generation. Docker is used to easily containerize and handle the start-up process for both services.

projects.name: Enigma Machine
projects.description: The Enigma machine is a simulation that emulates the operations of the renowned Enigma machine used during World War II. Users can input messages, configure rotor settings, and witness real-time transformations, providing an interactive and educational experience.

projects.name: Civilization VI Mod
projects.description: This is a mod for the popular turn-based strategy game, Civilization VI. The mod augments the Engineer unit to allow them to heal nearby mechanized units. The mod is available on the Steam workshop.

projects.name: JavaScript Tic-Tac-Toe
projects.description: This was one of my first web development projects. It's a simple HTML, CSS, and JS app in which you play tic-tac-toe against the computer. The app allows players to choose between "X" and "O", and keeps track of score across matches.

projects.name: Teatime
projects.description: Teatime is a simple Android app I made many years ago. It allowed you to select from a list of teas, and would provide optimal temperature and brew time for that tea. In addition to this, it could act as a timer to alert you when your tea is done brewing.
